Event.name: Posing_as
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> behaves as if they were a particular individual or type of <fen>Simulated_entity</fen> with the intent of misleading observers of their behavior. This is generally accomplished by altering their normal appearance (especially dress), mannerisms, voice, and other observable characteristics.
<ex><fex name="Agent">The belfast bank robbers</fex> <t>posed</t> <fex name="Simulated_entity">as police</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Agent">These groups</fex> are <t>masquerading</t> <fex name="Simulated_entity">as mainstream groups</fex>, yet after taking a closer look you see they are the most extreme.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that they are a particular individual or type of <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the posing event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including general descriptions comparing events (the same way) and salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>).</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that contributes to the his or her being perceived as a particular (kind of) <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
<ex>Some activists <t>posed</t> as delegates <fex name="Means">by wearing suits</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Simulated_entity
Arg.definition: <def-root>The type or individual that the <fen>Agent</fen> gives the impression of being.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to accomplish by posing as a particular (kind of) <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
<ex>He <t>posed</t> as a Hurricane Katrina evacuee <fex name="pur">in order to get food, clothing and money from Good Samaritans in Shreveport</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the posing event logically follows.
<ex>They <t>posed</t> as patients <fex name="exp">because the paper's previous attempt at a formal survey met strong resistance</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> gives the impression that they are the <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> impersonates the <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: impersonate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pretend to be (another person) for entertainment or fraud

lexUnit.name: masquerade.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pretend to be someone that one is not.

lexUnit.name: impersonation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: pretense of being (another person) for entertainment or fraud

lexUnit.name: impostor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who assumes a false identity in order to deceive or defraud.
